text: We are building an analytics software

for DTC (direct-to-consumer) brands that provides
valuable insights about their shoppers

and allow them to acquire better
customers,

and also retain more customers
from the ones that they already have.

AWS struck me
as a really reliable partner,

especially when it comes to scalability,
availability, and cost control.

It's really important to be
able to scale with your customer base.

There's two parts to our use
and partnership with AWS.
The first part is the infrastructure part,
where we use AWS's servers and databases

to ensure our products work smoothly
and also is always available.

The second part is the machine
learning insights
we offer with AWS SageMaker and AWS

Forecast to provide valuable insights
for the behavior of the shoppers.

I think for us,
being a relatively new company, we want to

focus our internal team's effort
in building the best product out there.

Once you get up and running
with AWS to help you launch a product,

you don't need to hand hold
and you can really focus on your product.
What I value most about AWS as a partner
is also the cost control

that help companies of our size
to stay on top of their finances.
The fact that we have a two way

communication channel
and they can help us grow as a company

and help our products get better,
but we can also provide feedback

and they will implement that feedback
so that companies

like us can better use their services
and offerings.

We furthermore
want to expand to the [United] States.
We want to open a new office there.

We really rely on AWS
to help us continue our growth.

So far it's been a great partner
and I think
we can reach higher goals together.
